manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Zombie Season The Dragonet Prophecy (Wings of Fire Graphic Novel) 39 Clues:Maze of Bones (A Graphic Novel) Legends of Lotus Island: The Guardian Test The Stonekeeper (Amulet) Discover more great books! You know the protocol. You've completed countless drills. Your go-bag is waiting by the door. Yet nothing can truly prepare you for what’s coming. No one is ever ready for zombie season... Not every dragonet wants a destiny ... Clay has grown up under the mountain, chosen along with four other dragonets to fulfill a mysterious prophecy.. He's not sure about the prophecy part, but Clay can't imagine not living with the his best friends. Minutes before she died Grace Cahill changed her will, leaving her decendants an impossible decision: "You have a choice - one million dollars or a clue." Young Plum is shocked to discover that she’s been accepted to the Guardian Academy on Lotus Island, an elite school where kids learn how to transform into Guardians, magical creatures who are sworn to protect the natural world. The first book in Kazu Kibuishi's #1 New York Times bestselling series that features a beautiful but dangerous world of new friends, giant robots, and shadowy enemies!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Engaging and Educational Journey through History
reviews.reviewText: I Survived the Nazi Invasion, 1944: A Graphic Novel is an exceptional addition to the I Survived Graphic Novel series. As an avid reader of historical fiction, I was truly captivated by this well-crafted and thought-provoking graphic novel.What struck me immediately was the beautiful artwork that effortlessly brought the story to life. The illustrations were vivid, detailed, and emotionally evocative, perfectly complementing the powerful narrative. The graphic novel format not only added a visual appeal but also made the story more accessible to a wider audience.The story is centered around young Mark, a Jewish boy living in France during the Nazi occupation in 1944. The author, Lauren Tarshis, skillfully weaves together historical facts with a gripping fictional narrative. Through Mark's eyes, we witness his struggle for survival, his resilience, and the bravery of those who risked their lives to save others.What I appreciated most about this graphic novel was its ability to educate and inform while entertaining. The historical accuracy was impressive, and the author didn't shy away from depicting the horrors of the time. However, it was done in a way that was appropriate for younger readers, ensuring they grasp the gravity of the events without being overwhelmed.The character development in this installment was exceptional. Mark's growth throughout the story was inspiring, as he faced danger, loss, and uncertainty. The supporting characters were equally well-developed, and their interactions added depth and emotion to the narrative.The pacing was spot-on, keeping me engaged from start to finish. The suspenseful moments were intense, and I found myself eagerly turning the pages to discover what would happen next. The graphic novel format allowed for a dynamic storytelling experience, immersing me in the action and emotions of the characters.As a teaching tool, this graphic novel is invaluable. It provides an engaging way for young readers to learn about the atrocities of the Nazi invasion while instilling empathy and understanding. It also encourages further exploration of this dark period in history.In summary, I Survived the Nazi Invasion, 1944: A Graphic Novel is a remarkable addition to the I Survived Graphic Novel series. With its stunning artwork, compelling storytelling, and educational value, it is a must-read for both young readers and history enthusiasts alike. I highly recommend this graphic novel for its ability to educate, entertain, and inspire.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Sad story! Your style is very effective.I was able to get through it quick. My nephew who will turn 10 next week asked for this book as a present. I ordered it and then was unsure if he may be too young for this. So I ordered it on kindle to read. It is a victory over Horror.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Used to be at the library but now it's only here and at Walmart. It was great.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Why its good
reviews.reviewText: I love this book I've already read it like 3 times before I request it for kids or adults who like graphic novels Five stars I wish I could give it a 10 star

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great graphic version of this I survived book- highly recommend!
reviews.reviewText: The graphic comic series of I survived books are fantastic- my son already loved the series but this takes it to whole new level. He loves them and this was no different. Great quality and seller- highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great novel. My daughter loves it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2021
reviews.reviewText: I promise I'm not a fake reviewer. I bought this for my 9-year-old he reads at a 3.5 AR level He's in third grade. He absolutely loves this book I'm going to read it next because it seems interesting, we got it yesterday and he's almost done with it today. He likes reading but he usually reads books way below his reading level and this has just made him want to really read and sit down. I just catch him at random times reading instead of playing his video games which is great. And plus they get to learn history at the same time I can't wait for the new ones to come out next year.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My kid loves these books!
reviews.reviewText: I have a “reluctant reader”….ok, honestly he’s more than reluctant, he HATES reading. However, these “I survived” graphic novels keep him interested in reading and he’ll even reread them. He said that this one was interesting and he can’t believe what it was like.
My students (grade 3/4) loved “I survived” books before they became graphic novels. This one never stays on the shelf!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Daughter absolutely loves these books. Easy to read not too much writing. We bought quite a few as gifts for her. Very happy!
